children.text: Identify and respond to various sensory stimuli
Focus on details of sense awareness and sensory recall
Use the senses to interpret experiences as actor and viewer
Identify and respond to feelings resulting from various stimuli
Focus on details of emotional and empathetic experiences
Use emotional recall to interpret and communicate experiences as actor and viewer
Use imagination in guided dramatic play
Use imagination to react to imaginary objects, environments, and perception in dramatic activities
Use imagination to interact cooperatively with others in dramatic activities
Use movement to react to a variety of stimuli
Use movement to explore thought, feeling, and roles from life, literature, and history
Use movement to express thought, feeling, and character from life, literature, and history
Develop language through social interaction
Develop descriptive language through dramatic activities
Use language to discover relationships with others through dramatic activities
Develop awareness of voice as means of expression
Use voice to communicate thought, feeling, and role in dramatic activities
Use voice for conscious communication of thought, feeling, and character
Develop responsibility through guided dramatic play
Develop responsibility through dramatic activities
Demonstrate self-discipline in dramatic activities
Demonstrate focused behavior in guided dramatic play
Develop techniques to focus and sustain attention in dramatic activities
Utilize concentration in the creation of drama
Develop positive self-image through guided dramatic play
Discover personal uniqueness and develop respect for individual differences
Discover self as effective in imagining, interacting, and reflecting in drama
Develop ability to join with and respond to others in guided dramatic play
Cooperate and interact during dramatic activities
Develop skills of cooperation and interaction through dramatic activities
Explore a variety of ways to solve problems
Explore problem solving and risk taking in dramatic context
Devise alternative resolutions to problems in a dramatic context
Participate in guided dramatic play
Participate in improvised dramatic activities
Explore improvisation through action and dialogue
Explore a variety of roles in life and fantasy situations through guided dramatic play
Explore a variety of roles in life and fantasy situations through dramatic activities
Explore characterization in life and fantasy situations
Observe the role of leaders in group activities
Develop leadership skills through dramatic activities
Recognize the function of a group leader as a director
Explore life experiences and develop imaginary situations through guided dramatic play
Apply observations of people, life and story elements in dramatic activities
Participate in playmaking by structuring the development and resolution of dramatic problems
Recognize elements of the environment during guided dramatic play
Recognize technical theatre elements used in dramatic activities
Explore the effect of selected elements of technical theatre in dramatic activities
Recognize selected elements of theatre house management through theatre attendance
Examine elements of theatre management through theatre attendance
Demonstrate knowledge of the functions of theatre management
Use literature as a basis for guided dramatic play
Use literature to create dramatic activities
Understand the relationship between dramatic literature and dramatic activities
Explore similarities and differences between life and theatre
Develop awareness of theatre heritage
Explore theatre heritage and history
Develop awareness of real and fantasy situations from many cultures through guided dramatic play
Explore real and fantasy situations from many cultures through dramatic activities
Explore multicultural concepts through dramatic activities
Develop awareness of a variety of community roles through guided dramatic play
Develop awareness of a variety of roles and occupations through dramatic activities
Explore a variety of roles and occupations including theatre and other arts
Explore the five W's through guided dramatic play
Explore the elements of drama in dramatic activities
Identify and use elements of drama
Experience live theatre
Respond to live theatre and understand the audience's role
Respond to live theatre and understand the audience's responsibility
Experience various art forms
Explore various art forms and relate to drama/theatre
Explore relationships between drama/theatre and other arts
Respond affectively to dramatic activities
Recognize and respond to unique qualities of drama/theatre
Explore drama/theatre in order to understand and appreciate the creative process

text:
Content Standard 1.0: Script Writing
Students will write scripts through improvising, writing, and refining scripts based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature, and history.

children.text: 1.1 Understand the principles of scene writing.
1.2 Participate in script writing by structuring the development and resolution of dramatic problems.
1.3 Explore personal situations through the creation of scripted scenes.
1.4 Utilize language to express meaning and character.
1.1 Understand the principles of script writing.
1.2 Examine life experiences and develop imaginary situations.
1.3 Demonstrate understanding of people, life, and story elements.
1.4 Participate in script writing by structuring the development and resolution of dramatic problems.
1.5 Explore dramatic situations through the creation of scripts.
1.6 Utilize language to express meaning, character, and subtext.
1.7 Utilize technical theatre elements in script writing.

text:
Content Standard 2.0: Character Acting
The students will develop basic acting skills by portraying characters in improvised and scripted scenes.

children.text: 2.1 Use emotional recall to create a character.
2.2 Use imagination to form and to express thought, feeling, and character.
2.3 Use characters to develop situations through individual and group work.
2.4 Utilize improvisational skills and techniques in creating a character.
2.5 Employ movement to express thought, feeling, and characterization.
2.1 Use sensory perception to enact multi-faceted characters, recognizing individual differences.
2.2 Use emotional recall to interpret and communicate experiences as actor and viewer, recognizing individual differences.
2.3 Use imagination to form and to express thought, feeling, and character.
2.4 Use characters to develop situations and environments through individual and ensemble work.
2.5 Utilize improvisational skills and techniques in creating a character.
2.6 Develop skills of analysis in acting.
2.7 Identify and use vocal techniques to portray thought, feeling, and character as an integral element of theatre production.
2.8 Employ movement to express thought, feeling, and characterization.
2.9 Explore characterization through the use of various styles of acting.
2.10 Examine technical theatre elements to enhance characterization.

text:
Content Standard 3.0: Scene Design
The students will design by developing environments for improvised and scripted scenes.

children.text: 3.1 Explore the functions and interrelated nature of various technical elements such as visual elements and aural qualities.
3.2 Identify technical requirements for improvised or scripted scenes.
3.3 Work collaboratively and safely to create elements of scenery, properties, lighting and sound.
3.1 Understand processes, techniques, terminology and materials of technical theatre and theatre management.
3.2 Develop a positive sense of self through theatrical collaboration.
3.3 Understand and analyze theatre management positions.
3.4 Understand and analyze theatre design positions.
3.5 Demonstrate knowledge of theatre as a profession and as an avocation.

text:
Content Standard 4.0: Directing
Students will direct by organizing rehearsals for improvised and scripted scenes

children.text: 4.1 Understand the functions and responsibilities of the director.
4.2 Develop leadership and collaborative skills through directing improvised and scripted scenes.
4.1 Understand the functions and responsibilities of the director.
4.2 Develop leadership and collaborative skills through directing formal and informal productions.
4.3 Explore solutions to acting, technical theatre, and theatre production problems and evaluate consequences and implications.
4.4 Understand the principles of stage movement as an integral element of theatre production.
4.5 Analyze a dramatic text to determine appropriate production values.

text:
Content Standard 5.0: Research
Students will research by using cultural and historical information to support improvised and scripted scenes.

children.text: 5.1 Discover and explore the contributions of people in a multi-cultural society.
5.2 Examine historical elements in society.
5.1 Understand, compare, and contrast various genres and periods of dramatic literature.
5.2 Discover and explore the contributions of people in a multi-cultural society in the development of theatre.
5.3 Examine historical motifs and themes of theatre.

text:
Content Standard 6.0: Theatrical Presentation
The students will compare and incorporate art forms by analyzing methods of presentation and audience response for theatre, dramatic media (such as film, television, and electronic media), and other art forms.

children.text: 6.1 Explore various art forms.
6.2 Examine dramatic productions as a synthesis of all the arts.
6.3 Integrate the knowledge of other art forms into the creation of dramatic productions.
6.1 Examine dramatic productions as a synthesis of all the arts.
6.2 Integrate the knowledge of other traditional arts into the creation of dramatic productions.
6.3 Integrate the knowledge of non-traditional new and emerging technological art forms into the creation of dramatic productions.
6.4 Understand elements of various arts forms.
6.5 Explore technical theatre as a means of integrating traditional and non-traditional art forms.
6.6 Achieve ensemble in performance works.

text:
Content Standard 7.0: Scene Comprehension
Students will analyze, evaluate and construct meanings from improvised and scripted scenes and from theatre, film, television, and electronic media productions.

children.text: 7.1 Respond to a variety of theatrical experiences.
7.2 Examine informal and formal theatre, film, television, and electronic media productions.
7.1 Respond to a variety of theatrical experiences as an effort to interpret, intensify and ennoble human experience.

7.2 Expand the depth and scope of aesthetic judgment by experiencing informal and formal theatre, film, television, and electronic media productions and theatre of diverse styles, periods, and genres.
7.3 Understand the role of the audience in creating a theatrical experience.

text:
Content Standard 8.0: Context
Students will understand context by analyzing the role of theatre, film, television, and electronic media in the community and in other cultures.

children.text: 8.1 Explain how attitudes of various cultures are reflected by theatre, film, television and electronic media.
8.2 Understand the role of theatre, film, television and electronic media in society throughout history.
8.1 Understand dramatic conventions and theatre genres throughout history.
8.2 Discover and explore historical motifs and themes.
8.3 Understand the role of theatre, film, television and electronic media on society throughout history.
